stories.text: I recently launched a single page website selling professional services. I've come to hate google analytics as it has become extremely confusing and complicated to use. I used clicky in the past but I have no interest in the "privacy first" BS that is now being forced through that service. I need to know which companies have visited the site. I just need "stats that matter", and not a million over complicated features i'm not going to use. What are people using for analytics these days, and is there still any great "self hosted" analytics these days?
stories.title: Ask HN: No-nonsense analytics for landing pages, in 2022
Algorithm can predict future crime a week in advance, with 90% accuracy
Reproducible ML experiments extension for VS Code

stories.text:
I'm interested in learning a new language over the summer. Mostly for the fun and challenge of it.

To give some context:

Most of my time is spent building interesting apps with Ruby on Rails.

Over the last few years I've tried a raft of JS-frameworks including Angular, Vue, React and some NodeJS things.

I've also experimented with Elixir/Phoenix.

Anyway, I'm curious what people here would recommend and where to start that journey...

Many thanks in advance.
stories.title: Ask HN: What language to learn this summer?
